I would certainly like a version of JUnit without any dependency on hamcrest
for when using with Groovy.  I find hamcrest very useful when using Java but
I haven't found a case where I would use it with Groovy and it is unfortunate
design that I have to include hamrest on the classpath to keep JUnit happy
but have no use for it. Some version which had a pom with hamcrest marked as
optional (if it is present at all) is what I would like to see and (although
somewhat more controversial) I would have a preference for all class
references to hamcrest done through reflection.

Cheers, Paul.

On 20/10/2012 4:34 AM, Marc Philipp wrote:
